Class OrdersPlacedController

java.lang.Object
com.example.rupizza.OrdersPlacedController
public class OrdersPlacedController extends Object
The `OrdersPlacedController` manages the UI for viewing, canceling, and exporting orders in the RuPizzeria app. It allows users to view order details, cancel selected orders, and export orders to a text file. The controller also provides navigation back to the main menu.
Author:
Raashi Maheshwari, Tanvi Yamarthy

  • Constructor Details

    • OrdersPlacedController

      public OrdersPlacedController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the OrdersPlacedController by setting up event handlers for buttons and combo boxes. It also populates the combo box with all placed orders and sets the order total field to be non-editable.

    • displayOrderDetails

      private void displayOrderDetails()
      Displays the details of the selected order, including a breakdown of each pizza in the order, the total price, and tax calculations.

    • updateOrderSum

      private void updateOrderSum(Order order)
      Updates the order list view and the total price field based on the selected order. It calculates the subtotal, sales tax, and total price for the order.
      Parameters:
      order - the order whose details will be displayed

    • findOrder

      private Order findOrder(int num)
      Finds the order with the given order number.
      Parameters:
      num - the order number to search for
      Returns:
      the order matching the order number, or null if not found

    • populateOrderBox

      private void populateOrderBox()
      Populates the order number combo box with the order numbers of all placed orders.

    • exportOrders

      private void exportOrders(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Exports all orders to a text file. The user selects the file location and the orders are written to the file, including details about each pizza and total prices.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event triggered by clicking the export button

    • createFileChooser

      private javafx.stage.FileChooser createFileChooser()
      Creates a file chooser for selecting the location and name of the file to export the orders to.
      Returns:
      a FileChooser object to select the export file location

    • writeOrdersToFile

      private void writeOrdersToFile(FileWriter writer) throws IOException
      Writes the details of all orders to the specified file writer. If there are no orders, a message indicating this is written to the file.
      Parameters:
      writer - the FileWriter used to write the orders to a file
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing to the file

    • writeOrderDetails

      private void writeOrderDetails(FileWriter writer, Order order) throws IOException
      Writes the details of a single order to the file.
      Parameters:
      writer - the FileWriter used to write the order details
      order - the order to be written to the file
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing to the file

    • formatPizzaDetails

      private String formatPizzaDetails(Pizza pizza)
      Formats the details of a pizza for writing to a file.
      Parameters:
      pizza - the pizza whose details will be formatted
      Returns:
      a formatted string containing the pizza's details

    • showAlert

      private void showAlert(String title, String message)
      Displays an error alert with the given title and message.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the error alert
      message - the message content of the error alert

    • showSuccess

      private void showSuccess(String title, String message)
      Displays a success alert with the given title and message.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the success alert
      message - the message content of the success alert

    • cancelOrder

      private void cancelOrder(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the cancellation of the selected order. If no order is selected or the order doesn't exist, an error message is displayed. If the order exists, it proceeds with cancellation.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event triggered by clicking the cancel order button

    • cancelCertainOrder

      private void cancelCertainOrder(Order orderToCancel, Integer selectedOrderNum)
      Cancels the specific order by removing it from the list of all orders and updates the UI accordingly. Displays a success message after cancellation.
      Parameters:
      orderToCancel - the order that is to be canceled
      selectedOrderNum - the order number of the order being canceled

    • UpdateUIAfterCancel

      private void UpdateUIAfterCancel(Integer selectedOrderNum)
      Updates the UI after an order has been canceled. It repopulates the order box and clears the list view and total price field.
      Parameters:
      selectedOrderNum - the order number of the canceled order

    • backToMain

      private void backToMain()
      Navigates the user back to the main menu. Loads the main menu scene and sets it in the current window.
